subject: p13849733
History: -year-old male with Wegeners granulomatosis, referred for followup of right pleural effusion.
Findings: Large right pleural effusion is unchanged in size. There is associated right basilar atelectasis/scarring, also stable. Healed right rib fractures are noted. On the left, there is persistent apical pleural thickening and apical scarring. Linear opacities projecting over the lower lobe are also compatible with scarring, unchanged. There is no left pleural effusion. There is no pneumothorax. Hilar and cardiomediastinal contours are difficult to assess, but appear unchanged. Vascular stent is seen in the left axillary/subclavian region.
Impression: Unchanged right pleural effusion. Stable multifocal scarring and left apical pleural thickening.
